thread.title_full: Southington remains No. 1 in The Day's Top 10 H.S. football poll

author: NED GRIFFEN
title: Southington remains No. 1 in The Day's Top 10 H.S. football poll
text:
Southington remains No. 1 in The Day's Top 10 H.S. football poll Published October 19. 2015 6:19PM Updated October 19. 2015 6:38PM 
The Day of New London Top 10 state coaches’ football poll is rather uneventful this week. A bevy of teams had byes last weekend because the season has reached its halfway point. 
There might not be many changes after this weekend, either. 
Ninth-ranked Ansonia is involved in the biggest game of Week 7 as it travels to play fellow unbeaten Torrington in what could be the biggest Naugatuck Valley League game of the season. 
Ansonia (5-0) has ruled the NVL almost every season, including being the league’s top team seven of the last 13 years. The Red Raiders (6-0) returned the league’s most experienced team and one of its most talented. They gave Wolcott its first loss last Friday (37-27). 
The Chargers have won 25 straight games against Torrington. The Red Raiders haven’t beaten Ansonia since 1986 (19-12). 
Other games that could affect the poll — No. 1 Southington (5-0) at Conard (4-1), Fairfield Prep (3-2) at No. 6 North Haven (5-0), Notre Dame-West Haven (3-2) at Hand (5-0), Capital Prep/Achievement First (4-0) at Abbott Tech/Immaculate (4-1), and Ellington (5-0) at Granby (5-0). 
None of the 13 coaches voted an Eastern Connecticut Conference team for the second straight week.
